p: The excessive amounts of reactive oxygen species (ROS) and reactive species can lead to the peroxidation of lipids, glycation/oxidation/nitration of proteins, inactivation of enzymes, DNA damage and other alterations in the cellular organelles12. The oxidative DNA damage led to cell death and tissue damage, and is generally regarded as carcinogenic and actively participates in many pathological processes, including cancer and aging3. Supplementation of antioxidants can therefore prevent and protect the human body from oxidative stress related diseases4.
